home.title: Hey, I'm Mateo üëã
home.subtitle: Embedded systems and IoT engineering student based in Paris. I write firmware, design PCBs, and 3D print my enclosures. On this site, you'll find my IoT projects, professional experiences, and everything related to microcontrollers and embedded electronics. Currently seeking an international internship!
home.aboutText: Passionate about embedded systems, I combine firmware development and hardware design to create complete IoT solutions. From drone validation at Aerommaper (Thales affiliate) to additive manufacturing projects integrating electronics, I love transforming ideas into functional prototypes.
home.aboutText2: With experience in STM32, ESP32, communication protocols (UART, SPI, I2C, MQTT), and real-time systems, I'm constantly seeking to deepen my technical skills and take on new challenges in the embedded field.

tourelle.title: Facial Recognition Turret
tourelle.intro: Motorized system integrating computer vision and facial recognition on Raspberry Pi. Internship project combining electronics, mechanics, Python development and technical communication.

objective.title: Objective
objective.text: Design a functional motorized turret with accessible and educational facial recognition system

context.title: Project Context
context.p1: During my internship, conducted as a pair, we worked on developing a motorized turret integrating a facial recognition system. This project combined electronics, mechanics, computer vision and technical communication.
context.p2: The main objective was to design an imposing and functional turret, based on a Raspberry Pi and Python development, while ensuring ease of use. The project also had to be educational and accessible to a wide audience, through regular communication via weekly videos demonstrating progress, without compromising visual quality or technical clarity.

demo.caption: Screenshot of facial recognition video feedback

step3.text: Design of mechanical parts necessary for turret support and movement.

step4.title: Manufacturing
step4.text: 3D printing and assembly of various mechanical and electronic components.

step5.title: Software Development
step5.text: Python programming for motor management and facial recognition implementation.

step6.title: Testing and Validation
step6.text: Performance evaluation, adjustments and public demonstrations of operation.

skills.p1: This project allowed me to develop concrete skills in Python programming, particularly in computer vision and motor control via Raspberry Pi.
skills.p2: I also gained experience in 3D modeling and mechanical-electronic integration, while learning to effectively communicate technical results in a clear and accessible manner.
skills.p3: Working in pairs strengthened my ability to collaborate, plan and meet time constraints in a semi-professional setting.

asservissement.title: Interactive Toy with Control System
asservissement.intro: Design of a mechatronic system integrating a rotating base and marble launcher. Project combining power electronics, PID control and Arduino programming.

objective.title: Objective
objective.text: Design a playful and functional device combining power electronics and control systems

context.title: Project Context
context.p1: As part of a school project in a team of four, we worked on the design and development of an interactive toy. It consisted of a rotating base and a marble launcher, integrating mechanical, electronic components and a control system.
context.p2: The project's objective was to design a playful and functional device, combining power electronics and control systems. The system had to use a DC motor for rotation and a servomotor for shooting, all controlled by an Arduino board.

step1.title: Functional Analysis
step1.text: Development of precise specifications defining needs, constraints and expected functionalities.

step2.title: Prototyping
step2.text: Creation of a prototype integrating the rotating base and progressive development of components (motor, servomotor, electromagnet).

step3.title: Command and Control
step3.text: Arduino programming to manage movements, with implementation of PID control to ensure precision.

step4.title: Testing and Adjustments
step4.text: Conducting test series to verify reliability and adjust parameters, while considering safety and efficiency aspects.

rotation.title: Rotating Base
rotation.text: Precise rotation system controlled by DC motor with feedback control

launcher.title: Marble Launcher
launcher.text: Shooting mechanism actuated by servomotor for projectile launching

pid.title: PID Control
pid.text: Precise movement control with proportional-integral-derivative regulation

power.title: Power Electronics
power.text: Power supply and high-power actuator control management

pid.title: What is PID Control?
pid.p1: A PID (Proportional-Integral-Derivative) controller is a control system that allows precise achievement and maintenance of a setpoint. In our project, it ensures precise rotation of the base by continuously correcting the error between the desired and actual position.
pid.integral: Correction based on accumulation of past errors
pid.derivative: Anticipation based on error rate of change

skills.title: Skills Developed
skills.p1: This project allowed me to put into practice my knowledge in electronics, embedded programming and control systems.
skills.p2: I was able to deepen my understanding of PID loops and their practical application, while working on the integration of mechanical and electronic elements in a single system.
skills.p3: This experience strengthened my skills in collaborative work, prototyping and development of automated systems.

amplification.title: Connected Audio Amplifier
amplification.intro: Design of an audio amplifier with energy optimization and SIGFOX IoT connectivity. Project combining analog electronics, amplification, filtering and data transmission.

objective.title: Objective
objective.text: Develop an audio amplifier combining energy efficiency, power gain and IoT connectivity

context.title: Project Context
context.p1: As part of a school project in a team of four, we worked on the design and realization of an audio amplifier integrating advanced optimization and connectivity features.
context.p2: The main objective was to develop an amplifier prototype combining energy efficiency and power gain, while ensuring mechanical robustness and ease of maintenance. A unique feature of this project was integrating data transmission via the SIGFOX network, allowing the device to connect to an IoT network.

step1.title: Preliminary Study
step1.text: Analysis of different types of amplifiers (passive and active) to determine the most suitable architecture.

step2.title: Simulation
step2.text: Design and validation of a first prototype on software to anticipate circuit behavior.

step3.title: Complete Prototype Realization
step3.text: Integration of electronic and mechanical components to build a functional system.

step4.title: Demonstration
step4.text: Presentation of the final prototype and validation of its performance under real conditions.

audio.text: Audio signal amplification and filtering with optimized power gain

types.intro: Our preliminary study focused on comparative analysis of different amplification architectures to select the optimal solution.

passive.text: Use of passive components (resistors, capacitors) - Simplicity but limited gain

active.text: Use of transistors or operational amplifiers - High gain and better control

skills.title: Skills Developed
skills.p1: This project allowed me to develop skills in analog and digital electronics, particularly in signal amplification and filtering.
skills.p2: I also gained better mastery of electronic circuit simulation tools and was able to experiment with integrating an IoT connectivity solution (SIGFOX) into an embedded system.
skills.p3: Finally, this teamwork taught me to reconcile technical performance, robustness and energy consumption constraints in electronic design.

meteo.title: Embedded Weather Station
meteo.intro: Environmental monitoring device designed for maritime context. Embedded weather station capable of providing complete measurement, monitoring and recording functions for environmental data.

context.title: Project Context
context.p1: As a team of four, we carried out a project around embedded systems aimed at designing an environmental monitoring device usable in a maritime context.
context.p2: The objective was to develop an embedded weather station, both easy to use for a crew member and capable of ensuring complete functions for measuring, monitoring and recording environmental data (temperature, humidity, pressure, etc.).

skills.p3: This collaborative work strengthened my ability to link user requirements, technical constraints and concrete realization.

portfolio.title: Portfolio Website
portfolio.intro: Modern multilingual portfolio website showcasing my projects, skills, and experiences in embedded systems. Built with React and Tailwind CSS to deliver a smooth and responsive user experience.

objective.title: Objective
objective.text: Create a professional portfolio to showcase my projects and facilitate international internship opportunities

context.title: Project Context
context.p1: As an embedded systems engineering student seeking international internship opportunities, I needed a platform to effectively present my technical skills and achievements.
context.p2: The goal was to create a modern, multilingual (French, English, Spanish) and easily maintainable website that reflects my technical expertise while providing an optimal user experience.
context.p3: I chose React for its flexibility and performance, combined with Tailwind CSS for modern, responsive design, and i18next for multilingual management.

multilingual.title: Multilingual support
multilingual.text: Interface available in French, English, and Spanish with dynamic language switching

responsive.title: Responsive design
responsive.text: Perfect adaptation to all screens (mobile, tablet, desktop)

design.title: Modern interface
design.text: Clean and professional design with smooth animations and transitions

navigation.title: Intuitive navigation
navigation.text: Clear structure with client-side routing for seamless experience

technical.title: Technical Details
technical.reactDesc: JavaScript framework for a dynamic and performant interface
technical.routerDesc: Client-side navigation for a smooth SPA experience
technical.tailwindDesc: Utility-first CSS framework for fast and consistent design

challenge1.title: Multilingual management
challenge1.problem: Setting up an efficient translation system covering all sections of the site with instant language switching.
challenge1.solution: Implementation of react-i18next with separate JSON files per language, enabling language change without reload and easy translation maintenance.

challenge2.title: Consistent responsive design
challenge2.problem: Ensuring optimal visual experience across all screen types while maintaining design consistency.
challenge2.solution: Using Tailwind CSS with mobile-first approach and custom breakpoint system, tested on various devices.

results.title: Results
results.p1: The portfolio provides a modern and professional user experience, facilitating the presentation of my technical skills and projects to international recruiters.
results.p2: The modular structure and well-organized code make it easy to add new projects and keep the site updated with my future experiences.

about.title: About
about.intro: Engineering student passionate about embedded systems, IoT, and electronics. Discover my journey, skills, and experiences.
about.bio1: I'm Mat√©o Repulles, a Master's student in Embedded Systems & IoT at EFREI, after completing my preparatory classes and Bachelor's degree at CESI. Passionate about electronics and firmware development for several years, I've had the opportunity to work on various projects ranging from drone validation to the design of electronic systems integrating additive manufacturing.
about.bio2: My approach combines solid theoretical training with concrete practical experience. Whether developing firmware on STM32, designing a PCB on KiCad, or debugging a real-time system, I enjoy tackling technical challenges and learning new technologies.
about.bio3: Beyond my studies and professional experiences, I'm also involved in the maker community, a member of the MakerCesi board, and a participant in WorldSkills for additive manufacturing. My hobbies include guitar, photography, 3D printing, and FPV drones.
